p.s: The article Globalised Environmental Pollution - Causes and Effects, written by Ankita Mitra, published on February 5 2014 in a blog on environment, informs us about the causes and effects of environmental pollution.
Ankita Mitra describes the environmental pollution as an introduction of harmful pollutants into the environment.
She wrote that these pollutants contaminate the environment and that they have a hazardous effect on the natural world and on the activities of living beings.
Environmental pollution can also have devastating effects on sea life, crops and human health so written in the article.
The environmental pollution affects plants, animals and human life in a very destructive way.
The gains we get from siencescience, technology and industrial progress there are so far at the cost of our health.

The environmental pollution is caused by the fall-out from nuclear tests, industries, smoke left behind the automobiles and other vehicular traffic, the increasing use of synthetic detergents, nitrogen fertilizers and insecticides that contaminate both water and air.
Because of the contamination our would is afflicted with a number of incurable diseases.
